title: Boeckel 2016 Midelberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Notions of ripe cherry fruit are evident from the start. This is fruity and fresh, full of tart cherry tones and a refreshing conifer edge. The body is slender and the light tannins offer a little crunch. A lovely, easy, authentic and fruit-driven wine.

title: Boschkloof 2015 Sons of Sugarland Syrah (Stellenbosch)
description: Bramble, licorice root and fresh fynbos lead the nose of this attractive wine, grounded by bold black-cherry and boysenberry fruit at its core. Firmly structured tannins lend serious grip and texture, while fruity flavors transition into waves of olive tapenade, cured meat and peppery spice on the enduring finish. It's drinkable now, but should be best with a bit more time; drink 2020–2025.

title: Botromagno 2014 Pier delle Vigne Red (Murgia)
description: This blend of 60% Aglianico and 40% Montepulciano boasts tobacco, methol and crushed herbs over a core of spicy bramble berries on the palate. There's solid structure, weight and intensity which echos the tones of the nose and carries those flavors on a tight mineral vein.

title: Buty 2015 Conner Lee Vineyard Merlot-Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine leans into the savory, with aromas of sliced green pepper along with assorted fresh herbs, flowers and macerated cherry. The palate is soft in style, filled with sleek, minerally cherry flavors. It brings a sense of freshness, purity and elegance.

title: Domaine Pfister 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A touch of reduction clouds juicy, ripe cherry notes on the nose but they appear edged by freshness on the light, taut palate. There is a pleasant grip of fine tannin and a slight crunch. A fresh-faced but very authentic and pure wine.

title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Turckheim Muscat (Alsace)
description: An earthy and very ripe notion of yellow plum and pear on the nose carry a hint of reduction. The palate follows this with zesty lemon notes on a dry but concentrated body. Honeysuckle carries on the clean, long finish.

title: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 The Furst Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The subdued scent of red and black cherry plays on the nose. On the palate this hints at fruit, with freshness and a fine frame of softly crunching tannins. A light-bodied but balanced wine of understatement and elegance.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Willamette Valley Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Cherry fruit shines here, balanced against well-managed acids and tannins. Some unspecified barrel aging adds hints of chocolate wafer. Despite its youth, this is already drinking quite well and should be consumed over the next half decade.

title: Erath 2015 Knight's Gambit Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Given the size of the winery, there unfortunately is very little of this single-vineyard offering, which is the best of the 2015s. Black-cherry fruit conjures up the classic flavors of the AVA, with good flesh and light notes of toast and mocha from the barrel aging.

title: Estrin 2014 Tre Aris Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Syrah (53%) takes the lead on this blend, followed by Merlot (27%) and Cabernet Sauvignon. Aromas of toast, anise, vanillin and cherry lead to rich, full-bodied cherry and cranberry flavors that coat the palate.

title: Fattoria di Magliano 2013 Poggio Bestiale  (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend of 40% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabenet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, this structured red opens with aromas of black plum, mocha and tobacco. The savory palate offers black currant, licorice and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Frei Brothers 2015 Reserve Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This soft, approachable red impresses in a mix of earthy mushroom, soy and cedar, its body thickly constructed around a core of ripe tannin and charred oak. Well structured, it finishes in bursts of black pepper and leather.

title: Glenelly 2015 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)
description: This leads with a powerful toasted-oak overlay to the ripe fruit tones of yellow melon, grilled apple and peach preserves. The mouthfeel is round and full, with a slightly pithy texture that lends some structure to the robust palate. Medium acidity keeps the richness in check, while a pleasant minty afterthought dances through the close. Drink now–2020.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Odem Vineyard Merlot (Galilee)
description: A bouquet of black plum, cassis and licorice leads into flavors of black cherry, raspberry, anise, white chocolate and violet. It is rich on the palate, with velvety tannins and touches of floral and spice notes on the finish.

title: Günther Steinmetz 2014 Kestener Herrenberg Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Mosel)
description: Shadowy notes of autumn leaves, dried lavender and earth accent delicate red cherry and raspberry in this pretty but rather diaphanous red. It's invigorating and fresh, offering crisp cranberry acidity and fine grained but persistent tannins that extend the finish.

title: Helioterra 2014 Dion Vineyard Syrah (Willamette Valley)
description: One of the better Syrahs from the Willamette Valley, this smooth and brambly effort is bursting with tart red and blue berries. There's a nice sprinking of cinnamon spice as well, and as with all of Helioterra's wines, the precision and focus are exceptional.

title: Helioterra 2015 Starthistle Cuvée White (Oregon)
description: This unusual blend mixes Riesling with rarely-seen Huxelrebe, a high-yielding early-ripening grape with scents similar to Muscat. The Starthistle is off dry, with honeyed fruits mixing peach, apricot and papaya. More palate weight than Riesling alone, yet it maintains Riesling's precision and elegance.

title: Holloran 2013 La Colina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A single block of Dijon 114 is the source here. This shows medium concentration in mixed berry flavors and peppery herbs. The balancing acidity brings a pleasing minerality. Drink now through 2020.

title: Il Conventino 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Truffle, new leather, violet and moist-earth aromas delicately lift out of the glass. The ethereal palate shows sour cherry, pomegranate and a hint of dark culinary spice alongside bright acidity. Lithe tannins offer light, polished support. Drink through 2020.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2016 3400 Premium Shiraz (Judean Hills)
description: A bouquet of black currant and flint sets the stage for flavors of black plum, cassis, dark chocolate and smoked meat. This wine is bright on entry, followed by deep spicy flavors set into a web of strong but not overbearing tannins. Brightness returns with a splash of acidity on the finish.

title: Johannishof 2016 Charta Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Strikes of zesty tangerine and lime are juxtaposed by swirls of mineral intensity in this light-bodied and austere wine. It's dry in style, with a piercing lemon-lime finish. Drink now through 2025.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: A blend of Castelão, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Francesa, this wine, with its wood aging still apparent, needs to age. It will turn into a rich wine, full of black fruits with a structure of generous tannins. Give this ripe wine until late 2018.

title: Le Marchesine NV Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Peach blossom, orchard fruit and bread crust aromas waft out of the glass. On the lively palate, fresh acidity provides the backdrop for yellow apple, fennel and lemon zest while a refined perlage lends finesse.

title: Majolini NV Extra Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this lively sparkler opens with aromas of brioche, wild red berry and crisp red apple. The aromas segue over to the vibrant palate along with a tangerine note. Tangy acidity lifts the finish while a hint of hazelnut signals the close.

title: Montage Vineyards 2012 Seven Sons Vineyard Syrah
description: Charred beef, pepper dust, oregano, thyme and sage make for a savory entry to the nose of this bottling from the Malibu area, but there is aromatic lift from dried lilac aromas as well. The palate is classical, with firm tannins carrying more herb and pepper as well as tar, blueberry and a slightly gamy quality.

title: Nera 2010 Inferno Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Enticingly delicate scents of wild berry, mountain herb, blue flower and a whiff of culinary spice come together on this fragrant Nebbiolo. The elegant vibrant palate offers tart cherry, crushed strawberry and a hint of star anise framed in tight, refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance. Drink through 2022.

title: Niepoort 2015 Gonçalves Faria Baga (Bairrada)
description: Named after the Gonçalves Faria family who own the vineyards, this is a wine produced with input from Dirk Niepoort of the Douro. Made entirely from Baga, it has plenty of tannins in an otherwise light wine. There is a sense of a traditional wine vinified in a traditional way. Drink from 2019.

title: Nottola 2013 Origine Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Wild berry, tilled soil, violet and cake spice aromas lift out of the glass along with an earthy whiff of new leather. The fresh, youthfully austere palate delivers red cherry, tangy cranberry, ground clove and crushed herb framed in fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Palazzo Vecchio 2012 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Fragrant purple flower, exotic spice, forest floor and baked plum aromas mingle with a whiff of new leather. The round juicy palate offers morello cherry, licorice and a salty note alongside supple tannins.

title: Pflüger 2016 Bunstandstein Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Electric acidity lends vitality to fresh yellow-apple and nectarine flavors in this dry, medium-bodied white. Despite its fresh, cutting style, the mouthfeel is expansive and rich, lingering through a long, spice-tinged finish.
